EmoQ: Anne, I was ambiguous.  I was afraid.
history:
***history***
female: (Neutral) You're the only one I know who loves his parents.
male: (Neutral) I know, it went out of style, didn't it?
female: (Neutral) It's all right.  It's a good thing.
female: (Neutral) You know, it's lovely here, the air is sweet.
male: (Neutral) You're not sorry you came?
female: (Neutral) No, not sorry.  Um, but, I'm- I'm not gonna stay.
male: (Sadness) Why?
female: (Frustration) Well, for one thing, your mother as much as told me to go.
male: (Neutral) Oh.
female: (Frustration) You saw that.  I mean and then, well, you've been kind of, um--
male: (Neutral) What?
female: (Frustration) Well, kind of embarrassed ever since I got here.
male: (Frustration) The trouble is, I planned on sort of sneaking up on you over a period of a week or so.  But, they take it for granted that we're all set.
female: (Frustration) I knew they would, your mother anyway.
female: (Frustration) Well,
female: (Sadness) from her point of view, why else would I come?
male: (Neutral) Oh.  Would you want to?  I guess you know, this is why I asked you to come.
female: (Excited) I--I guess this is why I came.
male: (Excited) Anne, I love you.  I love you a great deal.  I love you.
male: (Excited) I have no imagination.  That's all I know to tell you.
male: (Excited) I'm embarrassing you and I didn't want to tell it to you here.  I wanted some place we'd never been before.  A place where we'd be brand new to each other.
male: (Excited) You feel it's wrong here, don't you?  This yard, this chair.  I want you to be ready for me.  I don't want to have to win you away from anything.
female: (Excited) Oh, Chris, I've been ready for a long, long time.
male: (Neutral) And he's gone forever.  You're sure?
female: (Happiness) I almost got married two years ago.
male: (Excited) Why didn't you?
female: (Happiness) You started to write me and--
male: (Excited) You felt something that far back?
female: (Happiness) Every day since.
male: (Excited) Anne, why didn't you let me know?
female: (Excited) Well, I was waiting for you.  I mean, till then you never wrote and when you did, I mean, what did you say?  You can sure be ambiguous sometimes.
Based on the conversation ***history*** above, as male, please choose the most appropriate emotion among {Frustration,Neutral,Anger,Other,Disgust,Excited,Sadness,Happiness,Surprise,Fear} to respond to the female
SourceData: Give me a kiss, Anne.  Give me a-
Coct: Ah, I guess I can be a bit cryptic sometimes. But I was trying to be honest with you, even if it was in my own way.
